title: Mussels, Clams and Shrimp with Saffron Risotto and Green Olive Relish
summary: Mussels, Clams and Shrimp with Saffron Risotto and Green Olive Relish might be just the main course you are searching for. For $2.67 per serving, this recipe covers 24% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 406 calories, 16g of protein, and 12g of fat. This recipe serves 4. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. If you have shallots, tomatoes, garlic cloves, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and dairy free diet. Not a lot of people really liked this Mediterranean dish. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 76%. This score is good. Similar recipes include Capellini With Mussels & Clams In Rich Saffron Broth, Grilled Bread with Shrimp, Portuguese Aioli, and Green Olive Relish, and Steamed clams in saffron & spring green broth.

winePairing.pairingText: Clams on the menu? Try pairing with Chardonnay, Muscadet, and Riesling. Buttery chardonnay is great for scallops, shrimp, crab, and lobster, while muscadet is a classic pick for mussels, oysters, and clams. If you've got some spice in your shellfish, a semi-dry riesling can balance out the heat. The Hahn Winery Santa Lucia Highlands Chardonnay with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Hahn Winery Santa Lucia Highlands Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Rich and layered, with silky notes of peach, nectarine, ripe pear and vanilla.

instructions: Preparation                                                        Bring stock and saffron to simmer in medium saucepan. Remove from heat; cover to keep warm.                                                                Heat olive oil in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add shallots; saut√© until tender, about 2 minutes. Add rice and garlic; stir 1 minute. Add white wine and stir until absorbed, about 2 minutes. Add 1/2 cup saffron stock and simmer until absorbed, stirring frequently. Add remaining stock 1/2 cup at a time, allowing stock to be absorbed before adding more and stirring frequently until rice is cooked halfway, about 10 minutes. Add clam juice, mussels, littleneck clams, shrimp and chopped tomatoes. Cover and simmer until rice is tender, mussels and clams open, shrimp are cooked through and liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes (discard any mussels and clams that do not open). Divide seafood and saffron risotto equally among 4 bowls. Sprinkle with sliced green onions. Garnish with lemon wedges. Serve, passing Green Olive Relish separately.

steps.step: Bring stock and saffron to simmer in medium saucepan.
Remove from heat; cover to keep warm.
Heat olive oil in heavy large pot over medium heat.
Add shallots; saut√© until tender, about 2 minutes.
Add rice and garlic; stir 1 minute.
Add white wine and stir until absorbed, about 2 minutes.
Add 1/2 cup saffron stock and simmer until absorbed, stirring frequently.
Add remaining stock 1/2 cup at a time, allowing stock to be absorbed before adding more and stirring frequently until rice is cooked halfway, about 10 minutes.

Add clam juice, mussels, littleneck clams, shrimp and chopped tomatoes. Cover and simmer until rice is tender, mussels and clams open, shrimp are cooked through and liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes (discard any mussels and clams that do not open). Divide seafood and saffron risotto equally among 4 bowls.
Serve, passing Green Olive Relish separately.
